speaker: ARMY DOCTOR
line: I've reviewed your case and your service records. Combat duty in Panama... Grenada... distinguished service in the Gulf... great triumph and great tragedy. It's clear to me, Lt. Col., these suicide attempts of yours are simply just...

speaker: STANS
line: Cries for help!

speaker: ARMY DOCTOR
line: You've tried and failed to kill yourself in as many weeks. Frankly, if you wanted to...

speaker: STANS
line: You don't understand... He won't let me. He won't let me die!

speaker: ARMY DOCTOR
line: Who? Who won't let you die?

speaker: ARMY DOCTOR
line: Just relax a moment. I'll be back with something to help you sleep.

speaker: RAPPO
line: Stand down, Lt. Col!

speaker: STANS
line: NO! NOT THIS TIME!

speaker: STANS
line: NO! LET ME GO!

speaker: NURSE
line: Oh God!

speaker: FIREMAN
line: Where is he?

speaker: NURSE
line: In here.

speaker: STANS
line: I told you... He won't let me die...

speaker: STANS
line: I told you... I don't want to talk about it anymore. I told them and I told them and they won't listen.

speaker: MULDER
line: You mean they don't believe you.

speaker: STANS
line: No, sir.

speaker: MULDER
line: You said on the report that at the time of the accident you believed there was somebody else in the room.

speaker: STANS
line: It was no accident. Don't you understand?

speaker: MULDER
line: But this person saved your life. Is that right?

speaker: STANS
line: Look at me... Look! I have no life... He took it all away.

speaker: MULDER
line: You have any idea who it is?

speaker: STANS
line: I never see him clearly. But he looks like a soldier... always standing at attention.

speaker: MULDER
line: A GI?

speaker: STANS
line: Or one of Saddam's boys... come back to hold me accountable. Whoever it is... he knows my name.

speaker: MULDER
line: He speaks to you.

speaker: STANS
line: Your time has come, he said... Then he started taking it all away.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What did he start taking away?

speaker: STANS
line: Everything. My wife... my children...

speaker: SCULLY
line: And how did he do that?

speaker: STANS
line: How did he .. He burned them alive... Now he makes me suffer. Because he won't let me die. DRAPER Agents Mulder and Scully? May I have a word with you?

speaker: DRAPER
line: I've been asked to have you suspend whatever investigation you've begun here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Asked by whom, Captain?

speaker: DRAPER
line: General Callahan. Lt. Col. Stans' commanding officer.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is something wrong?

speaker: DRAPER
line: Protocol requires that all criminal investigation of military personnel to be conducted through military channels and their superior officer.

speaker: MULDER
line: What, we didn't sign in at the front desk?

speaker: DRAPER
line: You're in breach of code and procedure.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Excuse me, but is General Callahan the superior officer?

speaker: DRAPER
line: Ma'am?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Assuming we would want to investigate him, who would we talk to?

speaker: CAPTAIN
line: Investigate him for what?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Whatever.

speaker: DRAPER
line: General Callahan is the senior officer.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well then we'd like to speak to him on our way out.

speaker: DRAPER
line: I don't know that he's available.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Ask him to make himself available. Tell him that its our protocol. In the mean time, we'd like to finish up with Lt. Col. Stans. You never know when he might try to kill himself again.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Let's finish this, Mulder.

speaker: MAN
line: I keep having the same dream almost every night. I know a lot of crips have the same dream. "The Walk". In my dream, I rise up out of my chair, and I can stand. I look down the hallway, I'm not in the ward anymore, I'm home. With my baby girl.

speaker: MAN
line: Not even thinking about it, I take a step towards her... I take another step... and I pick her up and I carry her outside with me. With my own two feet. Outside is my little boy. We run together... Running! Me. My legs like they were before. We play a little bit of football... I show him a few moves... like my old man used to do. We just walk home. No crutches, no wheelchair. I know I'll never walk again, but this dream just seems so real. I can't help but think that maybe someday...

speaker: RAPPO
line: Don't hold your breath.

speaker: COUNSELOR
line: I think we'd all be interested in your point of view, Leonard.

speaker: RAPPO
line: Oh, you really want to know what I think? I pity all you guys, I really do. With your handicap basketball and your wheelchair races. You all act like we're normal people.

speaker: ANOTHER MAN
line: We are normal people.

speaker: RAPPO
line: I don't know if you've had a look in the mirror lately, my friend, but you are missing a leg.

speaker: RAPPO
line: I don't have any! Where... where'd my arms go?

speaker: COUNSELOR
line: We all know how you feel.

speaker: RAPPO
line: No, you don't. How the hell could you possibly know how I feel? There's only one way you could ever know. And I can only pray to God that he'll come down and take your legs and your arms away AND GIVE YOU A LITTLE TASTE OF WHAT IT FEELS LIKE!

speaker: RAPPO
line: Roach...

speaker: COUNSELOR
line: I'm sorry, gentlemen... let's begin again.

speaker: RAPPO
line: What is it, Roach?

speaker: ROACH
line: What?

speaker: RAPPO
line: You've got that "I'm freaking out" look on your face. What's the matter?

speaker: ROACH
line: It's nothing.

speaker: RAPPO
line: Bull. I spent two years with your sorry ass in a gun turret, I think I know when you've got something on your mind. Come on, Private. Make your report.

speaker: ROACH
line: It's the FBI. They're downstairs. They're asking questions about the L.C.

speaker: RAPPO
line: The hell with the Feds. Roach? You hear me? The hell with them. Just forget about 'em.

speaker: DRAPER
line: General... Sir?

speaker: DRAPER
line: Agents Mulder and Scully to see you Sir.

speaker: GENERAL
line: Thank you, Captain.

speaker: MULDER
line: General.

speaker: GENERAL
line: I want you to know I've had the Captain contact the Justice Department and let them know about the FBI's gross misconduct here.

speaker: MULDER
line: I guess this isn't a good time to thank you for seeing us.

speaker: GENERAL
line: Let me assure you, this matter will not go unaddressed.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I would hope not, considering the extremity to Lt. Col. Stans' case.

speaker: GENERAL
line: What case? There's no case. Stans is a very sick man.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, so we gathered. But his file is missing several interesting facts that came out of our interview with him.

speaker: GENERAL
line: I'm sure everything germane in Stans' situation is on file.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Except for any mention of the death of his wife and two children in a house fire three months ago.

speaker: GENERAL
line: Well, it was a tragic accident.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No doubt. But there is no record of any criminal or arson investigation.

speaker: DRAPER
line: Stans tried to save his family that night.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, according to him, he was prevented from doing so by some kind of phantom soldier.

speaker: GENERAL
line: Look. I've known Stans a long time and there's no doubt that he suffered terribly.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Not unlike Staff Sergeant Kevin Aiklen... isn't that correct, Sir?

speaker: GENERAL
line: He served under me in the Gulf. Yes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Six months ago, Aiklen also lost his family to a house fire. Afterwards he received psychiatric treatment for delusional behavior. Telling the doctors that he wanted to die, but that somebody wouldn't let him.

speaker: MULDER
line: Before throwing himself into a wood chipper on the hospital grounds. Now, unless that's procedure and protocol, I'd say that the incidents and details have been strangely overlooked, Sir.

speaker: GENERAL
line: Hold on. Just who's under suspicion, here?

speaker: GENERAL
line: Look. I make no excuses for the sadness of these men's lives, they're casualties of war. Once brave men who we can do little but feel sorry for. If you think there's more to it, you are seriously mistaken.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's your conclusion, General. But I'd hope you'll allow us the opportunity to come to our own.

speaker: MULDER
line: You really think the General's got something to hide?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. I think he's got everything to hide.

speaker: MULDER
line: You don't think he's just closing ranks to protect his men?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I know this isn't what drew you to this case to begin with...

speaker: SCULLY
line: But I think it's very clear what's going on here.

speaker: MULDER
line: What's that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The general is protecting his men, but what he's protecting them from is prosecution for the murder of their families.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why would he do that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know. But I can think of several good reasons.

speaker: MULDER
line: Because they were his soldiers and he feels somewhat responsible for the tragedies that have played out?

speaker: SCULLY
line: That could be one.

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe he knows the deeper secrets to their madness, the biological weapons they were exposed to during the war. The cause of the effect.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Considering the government's complete disavowment of Gulf War Syndrome, it's a pretty good reason to prevent our investigation.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But you're not buying it.

speaker: MULDER
line: You know, what I can't figure out is why a man who so deliberately and methodically set out to commit suicide would leave the one entrance to the room unsecured. But then again, I obviously have a feeble grasp of Army protocol and procedure.

speaker: GENERAL
line: Come in.

speaker: DRAPER
line: I want to apologize, Sir. I didn't mean to put you on the spot like that earlier.

speaker: GENERAL
line: I know that, Captain. This whole situation is unfortunate.

speaker: DRAPER
line: Is there anything more I can do?

speaker: GENERAL
line: No. Go home and get some rest. We'll deal with it in the morning. Relax, Captain. That's an order.

speaker: DRAPER
line: Yes, Sir.

speaker: RAPPO
line: Your time has come, killer.

speaker: ANSWERING MACHINE
line: Fox.... my dream....

speaker: FORT EVANSTON'S OFFICER GYM 10
line: 32 PM

speaker: GENERAL
line: Thank you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: General Callahan...

speaker: GENERAL
line: One of the detectives are saying Catherine Draper's death wasn't accidental.

speaker: SCULLY
line: There are bruises around her neck and her shoulder, roughly the size of fingermarks.

speaker: GENERAL
line: Then someone drowned her?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The bruises and surrounding edema are consistent with a struggle. Will you be contacting her family?

speaker: GENERAL
line: She had no family. The Army was her family.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm sorry. Truly.

speaker: MULDER
line: I talked with security personnel. Other than Captain Draper, they saw no one enter the pool last night and no one leave.

speaker: GENERAL
line: But the officers are saying she was drowned...

speaker: MULDER
line: General, do you have a family of your own?

speaker: GENERAL
line: Yes. Why?

speaker: MULDER
line: If the pattern we've seen is at all consistent, you and your family may be in danger.

speaker: GENERAL
line: Based on what? The death of my adjutant?

speaker: MULDER
line: Keep an eye out. Watch for anything out of the ordinary.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, you're serious?

speaker: MULDER
line: This is a military base, Scully. There's security everywhere yet nobody saw or heard a thing.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's not so hard to believe. Her screams would have been muffled underwater. There would be no fingerprints.

speaker: MULDER
line: It also fits the MO of Lt. Col. Stans' phantom killer.

speaker: GENERAL
line: Agent Mulder, what did you mean by that?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, just a word to the wise, Sir.

speaker: GENERAL
line: No. I mean anything out of the ordinary.

speaker: MULDER
line: Any unusual or unexplained phenomena.

speaker: GENERAL
line: Last night, I saw someone in my office. He said my name, but when I turned around, he was gone. Then my phone machine went all snaky again.

speaker: MULDER
line: Again? This happen before?

speaker: GENERAL
line: No. Not what I saw. But the phone calls, yes. Twice before at my home.

speaker: TREVOR
line: Mom! The mail's here.

speaker: TREVOR
line: MOM! MOM!

speaker: TREVOR
line: MOM! MOM! MOM!

speaker: FRANCIS
line: What is it? What is it, honey?

speaker: TREVOR
line: Mom, there's a man here.

speaker: FRANCIS
line: Who?

speaker: FRANCIS
line: Thank God you're home. I was trying to reach you. Trevor saw someone in the house. Just a few minutes ago.

speaker: GENERAL
line: Is he all right?

speaker: FRANCIS
line: He's just in his room, but he's terrified. I'm shaking myself.

speaker: GENERAL
line: Francis, these people are with the FBI.

speaker: FRANCIS
line: Is it about the break in?

speaker: GENERAL
line: Why don't you check on Trevor? I'll be right up.

speaker: FRANCIS
line: Why? What's happening?

speaker: GENERAL
line: Francis, please. We'll talk upstairs.

speaker: GENERAL
line: This way.

speaker: GENERAL
line: It just comes on. The phone doesn't even ring. At first, I thought it was a prank.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did you save the other ones?

speaker: GENERAL
line: No. I erased them.

speaker: GENERAL
line: I even called the phone company to have them check the line. They looked through the whole house, they couldn't find anything wrong.

speaker: MULDER
line: Have you noticed any other kind of electrical interference? The radio or the television?

speaker: GENERAL
line: Nope. Not a thing.

speaker: SCULLY
line: There's someone in the backyard.

speaker: SCULLY
line: There was someone out here, I'm sure of it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look.

speaker: MULDER
line: You'd better call the police, General.

speaker: NURSE
line: You're going to feel a little stick here.

speaker: NURSE
line: Okay, this is fine. I'll be back in a minute.

speaker: ROACH
line: That was too close, man. Too close.

speaker: ROACH
line: I'm not doing it anymore, understand?

speaker: RAPPO
line: What?

speaker: ROACH
line: I said, I ain't doing it anymore.

speaker: RAPPO
line: You owe me, Roach. I wouldn't be in this damn chair if it wasn't for you.

speaker: RAPPO
line: Hey! This isn't about you and me, man. This is about all the grunts and all the crips and all the boys who came home in a BOX! The enemy must be defeated. And we're going to do it! You're going to do your part and I'm going to do mine.

speaker: RAPPO
line: NURSE! Hey, what do you do, man, when I rap on the tank?

speaker: ROACH
line: Get some, get some. Fire at will.

speaker: RAPPO
line: Good. You're all right. NURSE! Come on! This is killing me here.

speaker: NURSE
line: You'll have to learn to sit still.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Find anything?

speaker: MULDER
line: No. But I'm really beginning to like the tune.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, we've been a bit luckier. Whoever startled the General didn't just leave footprints... he left fingerprints as well.

speaker: MULDER
line: Really? Where?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Forensics just lifted two matching indexes and a thumb. On the mailbox next to the front door, and one on the door leading into the backyard.

speaker: MULDER
line: Want me to go run 'em?

speaker: SCULLY
line: They're on the way to the NCIC as we speak.

speaker: SCULLY
line: FBI! Open the door!

speaker: ROACH
line: Don't shoot! Don't shoot.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hands up. Hands up. Put your hands over your head.

speaker: ROACH
line: Okay, okay, okay.

speaker: MULDER
line: Put your hands down behind your back. Cuff him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mr. Freely, you are under arrest for suspicion of murder. You have the right to remain silent. Anything you say can and will be used against you in a court of law.

speaker: SCULLY
line: If you want an attorney, we will get you one...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Captain Janet Draper... Staff Sergeant Kevin Aiklen... Lt. Col. Victor Stans...

speaker: MULDER
line: General and Mrs. Thomas Callahan...

speaker: SCULLY
line: We've got him, Mulder.

speaker: SOLDIER
line: Watch your left flank, there.

speaker: TREVOR
line: Okay.

speaker: SOLDIER
line: Trevor? Hey Trevor!

speaker: SCULLY
line: In addition to accessory to murder, you're looking at conspiracy, breaking and entering, commission of a felony on federal property...

speaker: ROACH
line: Can I get a cigarette?

speaker: MULDER
line: No!

speaker: SCULLY
line: We know you weren't acting alone, Quentin. We know you had an accomplice.

speaker: MULDER
line: How did he do it, Quinton?

speaker: ROACH
line: I don't know. I don't know what you're talking about.

speaker: MULDER
line: How did he get past the guards? How did he kill him? Trevor was only 8 years old.

speaker: ROACH
line: I don't know. I didn't kill anybody.

speaker: ROACH
line: I'm just the mailman.

speaker: MULDER
line: What does that mean, you're just the mailman?

speaker: ROACH
line: Rappo's mailman.

speaker: NURSE
line: Leonard Trimble, right?

speaker: SCULLY
line: If that's the man they call Rappo.

speaker: NURSE
line: Well, that's him. What's he done?

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's a suspect in two homicides.

speaker: NURSE
line: Rappo? You must be making some kind of mistake.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How's that?

speaker: NURSE
line: There.

speaker: NURSE
line: See for yourself. He's a quadruple amputee.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Damn it! He lied to us.

speaker: MULDER
line: He said he was the mailman. What did he mean by that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know. I'm adding it to the list. Are you coming?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'll catch up with you later.

speaker: ROACH
line: He knows this place! He'll find me here! He's been here before!

speaker: ROACH
line: I'm not safe here!

speaker: GUARD
line: Hey! Keep it down in there!

speaker: ROACH
line: Get me out of here! He's going to kill me! Let me out! LET ME OUT!

speaker: GUARD
line: I'm not going to tell you again.

speaker: ROACH
line: He's going to kill me!

speaker: ROACH
line: He's here! HE'S HERE!

speaker: GUARD
line: You don't want to get him started again. He was pretty worked up about an hour ago.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Not as worked up as I'm going to be.

speaker: GUARD
line: Visitor. On your feet.

speaker: GUARD
line: God, almighty.

speaker: MULDER
line: How did it happen?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Suffocation. The bed sheet was stuffed down his throat.

speaker: MULDER
line: Had anybody been in the cell with him?

speaker: SCULLY
line: He did it all by himself.

speaker: MULDER
line: Not likely.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Not likely?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah. He had help. Scully, and he wasn't lying because I think the man who killed him was Leonard Trimble.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Rappo?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He can't even walk, let alone kill somebody.

speaker: MULDER
line: You see this?

speaker: MULDER
line: This is an X-ray dental plate.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I know. You've been walking around with that thing since we got here.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, actually, the ones I've been walking around with I had developed at the hospital.

speaker: MULDER
line: See, this is the one I was carrying when we first met Stans... this one in the rehab room, in the pool, in the General's office, and this one in the General's house. All of them exposed to some kind of radiation.

speaker: SCULLY
line: From what?

speaker: MULDER
line: From Stans' phantom soldier. I came down here wondering if it could be true, what Lt. Col. Stans was describing was a case of astral-projection.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What you're saying is this man, Rappo, is leaving his body and floating around town killing people?

speaker: MULDER
line: Practitioners claim that during a self hypnotic trance, the astro body can actually detaches itself and can float virtually anywhere, sometimes invisible, but sometimes appearing as a apparition. They even claim that the astro-body has psychokinetic capabilities that is far greater than the corporeal body.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder... then why would he need Quintin Freely?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, maybe he needs a psychic connection to a place. A thing or an object... a letter! That's why Quinton called himself the mailman.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's insane...

speaker: MULDER
line: Sometimes the only sane response to an insane world is insanity.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you know anything about backwards masking?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You mean, messages recorded backwards in songs?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, or on the General's answering machine. Check this out.

speaker: TAPE
line: Your time has come, killer. Your time has come.

speaker: MULDER
line: Leonard Trimble?

speaker: RAPPO
line: No, it's Fred Astaire.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mr. Trimble, we'd like to ask you a few questions about Quinton Freely.

speaker: RAPPO
line: Roach? What'd he do now?

speaker: MULDER
line: He's dead.

speaker: RAPPO
line: Well... serves him right.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How's that?

speaker: RAPPO
line: How's that? Oh, he's only the guy that turned me into second base by getting my arms and legs blown off. Other than that, he was a real good guy.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why did you kill him?

speaker: RAPPO
line: What's wrong with this picture?

speaker: MULDER
line: I read your medical record, Leonard. We know that you refused all efforts at rehabilitation. You've even refused to be fitted with prosthetic limbs.

speaker: RAPPO
line: Big deal... Maybe I don't want any of that crap.

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe because you don't need it. Because you can leave your body anytime you want. Kill anybody you want to kill.

speaker: RAPPO
line: If I could leave my body right now, I could think of something else I'd rather be doing.

speaker: MULDER
line: Like kill General Callahan's boy? Lt. Col. Stans' family? Sergeant Aiklen?

speaker: RAPPO
line: You're a real trip.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, I'm a trip, because I figured you out? You're a soldier. You knew what you were getting into when you enlisted. Now you want to blame everybody else. Why do you want to blame your COs?

speaker: RAPPO
line: I blame him for what happened to all of us. You don't know what it was like... You sat home and watched the war on cable TV like it was a damn video game. You have no idea about the guys that died. About the blood... the sand. What it feels like when a hit comes. Thing is, you just don't care, do you? You got your crude oil. Just change that station, right? Killer got his prime time. LC got his fancy little medals. Now, take a good look at me, WHAT DID I GET?! Nobody knows how I feel. They took my life away.

speaker: MULDER
line: So you took theirs.

speaker: RAPPO
line: If I only could. Now if you're through questioning me, I'd like to get a little shut eye.

speaker: MULDER
line: No sleepwalking.

speaker: RAPPO
line: That's good. I haven't heard that one yet. Hardy-har-har. HALLWAY SCULLY? What do you want to do?

speaker: MULDER
line: Call General Callahan... tell him to stay out of his house.

speaker: GENERAL
line: Francis...

speaker: GENERAL
line: Honey. Leave that.

speaker: FRANCES
line: I know how it upsets you when his... toys are spread all over the place.

speaker: GENERAL
line: We can handle this, Francis.

speaker: FRANCES
line: I don't want to handle it. I want my son back.

speaker: GENERAL
line: Frances?!

speaker: GENERAL
line: Frances!!

speaker: GENERAL
line: Oh...

speaker: GENERAL
line: Oh, no.

speaker: GENERAL
line: My God... CAR

speaker: SCULLY
line: No one's answering and the machine's not picking up.

speaker: STANS
line: General?

speaker: GENERAL
line: Lt. Colonel.

speaker: STANS
line: What are you doing?

speaker: GENERAL
line: You were right, Victor. He won't let you die.

speaker: STANS
line: Sir...

speaker: GENERAL
line: He kills our wives and children, but he won't let us die...

speaker: STANS
line: I know who he is, General. I know who he is.

speaker: RAPPO
line: General Callahan, Sir. I've been waiting for you.

speaker: GENERAL
line: Who are you?

speaker: RAPPO
line: One of your boys, General.

speaker: GENERAL
line: You killed my wife.

speaker: RAPPO
line: That's right, Sir. I did, and the boy, too.

speaker: RAPPO
line: Come on, killer.

speaker: RAPPO
line: Come on, Killer Callahan, get some! GET SOME!

speaker: RAPPO
line: Come on, Killer. Do it! Fire at will!! Come on, Killer, do it.

speaker: RAPPO
line: Come on, Killer. You can do better than that. Come on.

speaker: GENERAL
line: You're going to suffer like the rest of us.

speaker: RAPPO
line: Oh, you think I'm going to let it end this way? Do you?! Is that what you think?!

speaker: SCULLY
line: General?

speaker: SCULLY
line: General?

speaker: GENERAL
line: He wanted me to kill him. I stood down.

speaker: GENERAL
line: I'm done here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's having some kind of a seizure.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, I don't think so.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Nurse!

speaker: MULDER
line: General Callahan!

speaker: RAPPO
line: Killer? Come on Killer.

line: Your time has come.

speaker: MULDER
line: General Callahan?!

line: He's non responsive.

line: Come on.

line: Put him on monitors and prep the crash cart. He's going into cardiac arrest.

line: Okay.

line: And make sure the team...

line: Get the keys, we have to open the door.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Open the door!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Lt. Colonel, open the door!

speaker: MULDER
line: General Callahan... are you hurt?

speaker: GENERAL
line: I'm okay.

speaker: MULDER
line: No evidence was found linking Leonard Trimble to the deaths of General Callahan's wife and son. Officially, the case remains open. The murders unsolved.

speaker: MULDER
line: Leonard Trimble's family requested his burial at Arlington National Cemetery. The Army denied this request. Trimble was cremated, his ashes interred at a civilian cemetery in Tannersville, PA. Leonard Trimble's mission was not to kill his enemies... but to shatter their lives... to keep them alive. To suffer the pain that he charges against Lt. Col. Victor Stans after a lengthy investigation. Stans was released from the hospital and posted under medical supervision at Ft. Evanston.)

speaker: MULDER
line: Amputees sometimes feel the pain of phantom limbs... ghosts of hands still clenching... legs, still aching.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is it not possible that Trimble developed a phantom soul? A malevolent psyche that took its revenge on those he held accountable?

speaker: MULDER
line: nan

speaker: (WHAT THE REST OF US HEARD
line: ) It was war that destroyed Leonard Trimble's body... but his wounds went deeper than the loss of his limbs... What destroyed those parts of him that make us human beings? Those better angels of our nature? I cannot say.
